subject: Re: [junit] Re: Filtering tests using anotations
msgSnippet: Roman, I agree that this should be easier: likely 99.5% of the runners out there have tests that correspond one-to-one with Java methods, and making it easier
messageBody:
Roman,

I agree that this should be easier: likely 99.5% of the runners out
there have tests that correspond one-to-one with Java methods, and
making it easier to Filter and Sort on these is a good extension.
There's a feature request already in place for this:

http://sourceforge.net/tracker/index.php?func=detail&aid=1569265&group_id=15278&atid=365278

There's a lot already on our plate for 4.4, but I'd like to think more
about how to do it in 4.5 or .6. Thanks,

David Saff

On 3/28/07, roman.kitko <roman.kitko@...> wrote:
> --- In junit@yahoogroups.com, "David Saff" <saff@...> wrote:

> Hi David,
>
> I have implemented this myself, it was really easy :
> create FilteredTestClassMethodsRunner,TestMethodDescriptionEx and Filter.
